activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harry D. Blevins

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on January 10, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

3:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Harry D. Blevins in court. Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court for Harry D. Blevins. Victims representative in court. Information has been filed that mirrors Complaint. Finlan waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Sowinski statement to documents in case that need to be reviewed by Finlan. Sowinski statement to restitution. Bond continued. adj. 03:47 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Harry D. Blevins appeared by phone. Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court for Harry D. Blevins. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer requests a separate arraignment date. Bond continued. adj. 03:13 PM
Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
